responses: Your Order ID appears on the payment success page right after you complete your purchase.
You will also receive your Order ID in the confirmation email sent to the PayPal address you used.
Check the success page or your confirmation email — your Order ID is shown in both places.
If you completed the payment process, your Order ID should be visible on the success screen and included in your email receipt.

responses: If your receipt didn’t arrive, it may have been delayed or filtered by your email provider. Please contact FitTrack support through the contact page so we can resend it.
A missing receipt usually means the email was blocked or delayed. Reach out to support and let them know you didn’t receive your PayPal confirmation.
If PayPal did not send you a receipt, please contact FitTrack support so we can verify your payment and resend the confirmation.
Please use the contact page to notify support that your payment receipt wasn’t delivered. We’ll help you resolve it quickly.

A completed payment always leads to the success page and a confirmation email sent to you.

responses: To reduce calories, focus on high-volume, low-calorie foods like vegetables, salads, lean protein, fruit, and Greek yogurt. Drinking water before meals also helps.
Try replacing high-calorie foods with lighter options, eating slower, and avoiding sugary drinks or processed snacks.
Choose meals that combine lean protein and vegetables — they help control hunger while keeping calories low.
Boost protein and fiber to stay full longer. These naturally reduce your calorie intake throughout the day.

responses: Good foods for weight loss include eggs, chicken breast, fish, Greek yogurt, vegetables, fruits, oats, beans, and leafy salads. These keep you full with fewer calories.
High-protein, low-calorie foods such as tuna, turkey, egg whites, legumes, and low-fat Greek yogurt are excellent for weight loss.
You can support weight loss with foods high in volume but low in calories, such as cucumbers, zucchini, spinach, broccoli, and soups.
For effective weight loss, focus on lean protein, vegetables, whole grains, and avoid heavily processed foods high in sugar and fats.

responses: Foods that help build muscle include chicken, beef, eggs, fish, Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, lentils, beans, quinoa, and whey protein.
Prioritize high-protein foods like tuna, turkey, eggs, whey protein, tofu, and lean meats to support muscle growth.
Pair protein with carbs such as oats, rice, potatoes, and whole grains — this helps fuel performance and recovery.
Aim for consistent protein intake throughout the day along with a slight calorie surplus for best muscle-building results.

responses: Great high-protein, low-calorie foods include egg whites, tuna, cod, shrimp, chicken breast, turkey breast, tofu, low-fat Greek yogurt, and cottage cheese.
Lean protein sources like Greek yogurt, egg whites, shrimp, and white fish offer strong protein with very few calories.
White fish, turkey, and tuna are some of the highest-protein foods per calorie — ideal for cutting or weight loss.
Lean meats, egg whites, and low-fat dairy help you increase protein intake without adding many calories.

responses: Great pre-workout meals include oatmeal with fruit, Greek yogurt with honey, chicken with rice, a banana with peanut butter, or a protein shake with oats.
Choose easily digestible foods like fruit, yogurt, oats, or rice cakes for steady energy without feeling too full.
A good pre-workout meal has carbs for energy and a bit of protein. Examples: oatmeal, bananas, rice, Greek yogurt, or whole-grain toast.
If you want something light, try fruit, a protein shake, rice cakes, or low-fat yogurt before your workout.
Avoid heavy meals before training. Stick to foods that digest easily so you feel energized, not sluggish.

responses: Great post-workout meals include chicken, eggs, tuna, Greek yogurt, protein shakes, rice, potatoes, oats, and fruit — aim for protein plus carbs.
After training, focus on protein sources like turkey, eggs, whey protein, or fish along with carbs like rice, potatoes, or fruit to refuel.
Eat within 1–2 hours of training. Choose meals like chicken and rice, eggs and toast, or a protein shake with fruit.
If you can't eat right away, start with a protein shake and follow with a balanced meal later for full recovery.
Protein repairs muscles, and carbs restore energy — combining them after exercise speeds up recovery.

responses: Useful post-workout stretches include hamstring, quad, glute, chest, shoulder, and back stretches. Hold each for 20–30 seconds.
A simple cool-down includes hamstring stretch, quad stretch, hip-flexor stretch, calf stretch, chest opener, shoulder stretch, and a gentle spinal twist.
Stretching after training reduces stiffness. Focus on legs, hips, chest, shoulders, and back — hold each stretch without bouncing.
To reduce soreness, stretch all major muscle groups you trained. Slow, controlled breathing helps relaxation.
Walk lightly for a few minutes, then stretch all major muscle groups to complete a balanced cool-down routine.
